Package islands

Class Store

java.lang.Object
islands.Store
public class Store
extends java.lang.Object
A store is a place to buy and sell items. Every island has a store, and every store has different prices that it'll buy and sell an item for.
Author:
Andrew Hall

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Store​(java.lang.String shopName, java.util.HashMap<TradeTypes,​java.lang.Float> itemPrices)
    Creates a new island that values each trade type accordingly

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addUpgrade​(Upgrade upgrade)
    Adds the given upgrade into the store's upgrade pool
    TradeGood buyItem​(TradeGood item)
    Takes an item (usually an "unbought" item from a store), and fills out all the fields about where/how much it was bought for
    static java.util.HashMap<TradeTypes,​java.lang.Float> getDefaultPrices()
    Creates a pricing map of every type, initialized to 1 (base value)
    static Store getDefaultStore()
    Gets the default store, a store with no item preferences

  • Constructor Details

    • Store

      public Store​(java.lang.String shopName, java.util.HashMap<TradeTypes,​java.lang.Float> itemPrices)
      Creates a new island that values each trade type accordingly
      Parameters:
      itemPrices - A mapping of TradeType: ValueMultiplier e.g. a $50 item with a 0.8 multiplier is worth $40 at this store
      shopName - The name of this shop, usually bound to any bought items

      Returns:
